meta.title: AI in Action
meta.subtitle: Automation & AI Projects by Lucas Willett

activity.event: Matterport Health Checker built — crawls 20K+ Matterport models from TrueTour export, checks each via API for active/dead status, maps failures back to property IDs. Catches broken 3D tours before customers hit oops screens.

Cvent Synergy deployed — automated Cvent Event Diagramming workflow. Google Form intake, URL validation, task package generation, Slack notifications to Hannah, thread-based completion tracking, and QA link checks. Always-on via launchd.
Support Triage Assistant built — Gemini Gem with 6 knowledge docs covering login issues, broken links, terminology, and 502/504 errors. Full team trained across 4 dry run scenarios.
Confluence page created: 'Investigating 502 & 504 Errors in Datadog' — live Datadog Log Explorer training artifact from GA training session
Helm dashboard launched — personal ops command center with Tasks, Calendar, AI Quick Capture, and weather
Batch redirect checker completed — 1,941 properties scanned, 93 bad redirects flagged
Claude Relay made persistent via launchd — Slack notifications wired to #lucas-briefing
TourFinder sub-brand detection improved — Marriott family (AC Hotels, Gaylord, etc.) now recognized
Playwright Browser Automation deployed - headless scripts replace screenshot-heavy workflows
Command Bot deployed - run automation from phone via Slack
Help Center Article Pipeline connected to Google Drive
Redirect Checker Slack bot deployed - on-demand scans via #support-internal
AI in Action portfolio site launched

projects.name: Support Triage Assistant
projects.tagline: AI triage copilot for platform migration support
projects.description: Gemini Gem deployed on Google Workspace for the 3-person support team. Covers 4 triage workflows — login failures, broken share links, terminology confusion, and 502/504 errors. Knowledge base lives in 6 Google Docs for live editing with zero re-upload friction. Built as an enterprise Claude stopgap ahead of VMP GA.
impact: Single-mode smart routing — describe the issue, Gem picks the workflow
Adaptive coaching — matches pace to user confidence level
Copy-paste Jira ticket generation (BUG and DSO project templates)
Live-editable knowledge docs — update the doc, Gem picks it up immediately

projects.name: Helm
projects.description: Personal operational memory dashboard. Turns meetings into memory, memory into action. Surfaces Google Tasks (My Tasks + project context panels), Google Calendar with live meeting status, AI-powered Quick Capture that distills raw notes into tasks, hourly weather, and a live to-do list synced from CLAUDE.md.
impact: Single tab replaces 4+ context switches (Tasks, Calendar, notes, Slack)
AI Quick Capture turns messy Slack DMs into clean Google Tasks
Calendar filtered to real meetings — red/orange time blocks hidden
Helm Tasks card tracks in-flight engineering work from CLAUDE.md

timeSaved.calculation: 20 min/day × 5 days (consolidates task review, calendar check, capture)

projects.name: Help Center Article Pipeline
projects.description: End-to-end article workflow. Team posts ideas to #help-center-ideas → AI generates draft → uploads to Google Drive folders → tracks in spreadsheet → notifies SME. Governance board drags articles through review stages.
impact: Self-service article submissions via Slack
AI-generated first drafts with templates
Automatic SME assignment from taxonomy
Progress tracking across 5 review stages

projects.name: Command Bot
projects.description: Slack-based remote control for all automation. Send commands from phone in #lucas-briefing: !status, !run pipeline, !run watcher, !services, !zaps. Results posted back instantly.
impact: Trigger automation from anywhere
Check system health on the go
No laptop/terminal needed

projects.name: Browser Automation
projects.description: Playwright-based browser automation with persistent sessions. Replaces screenshot-heavy AI workflows with lightweight scripts that extract data directly. Session manager saves auth state so scripts run headlessly without re-login.
impact: 90% reduction in AI token usage for browser tasks
Persistent sessions across script runs
Template system for rapid new automations
Integrates with Command Bot (!zaps)

projects.name: Incident Commander
projects.description: Custom GPT connected to Zendesk & Slack APIs. Automates incident declaration, macro creation, Help Center updates, and cross-channel communications. One person can now run the entire Support-side incident workflow from a single conversation.
impact: Reduced P1 coordination overhead
Consistent messaging across all channels
Draft-then-publish approval workflow

projects.name: Claude Relay
projects.description: Two-agent system enabling Claude Code (terminal) and Browser Claude to work together. Task queue with web UI for real-time coordination between AI instances.
impact: Terminal + Browser AI working in tandem
Automated task handoffs
Human-supervised AI collaboration

projects.name: TourFinder
projects.description: Slack bot monitoring #channel-distribution and #support-internal. Responds to property questions with high-traffic examples from ChurnZero, and finds verified third-party platform examples automatically. When someone asks 'any Hilton properties on Cvent?', TourFinder crawls the Cvent venue directory, searches DuckDuckGo, checks each profile for embedded TrueTour links, and returns verified examples with live URLs — a process that takes 30+ minutes manually per platform search.
impact: Third-party example finder — crawls Cvent, TripAdvisor, etc. for verified TrueTour embeds
Eliminates manual platform-by-platform searching for distribution examples
Instant property lookups with brand hierarchy awareness (IHG → Holiday Inn Express)
Distribution gap detection — flags properties with platform profiles but no TrueTour embed
Self-service for sales and distribution team prep

timeSaved.calculation: 30 min/query × 15 queries/week (third-party example searches are 30+ min manual)

projects.name: Cvent Synergy
projects.description: End-to-end automation for Cvent Event Diagramming channel distribution requests. Google Form intake feeds a tracking sheet. Bot validates URLs, scrapes space names, generates ready-to-paste task packages (Mattertag content, Element configs, appearance settings), and posts to Slack. Human does the spatial/creative work, replies 'done', and the bot runs QA link checks and closes the loop.
impact: Formal submission process replaces ad-hoc spreadsheet updates
URL validation catches bad links before work begins
Pre-filled task packages eliminate copy-paste hunting
QA link check catches broken links before customer sees them

projects.name: Matterport Health Checker
projects.description: Crawls all Matterport embed URLs from TrueTour (20K+ models), checks each against the Matterport API for active/dead status, and maps failures back to property IDs. First run found 1,021 dead models across 204 properties — broken 3D tours customers were hitting as oops screens. Runs with checkpoint/resume, concurrent workers, and produces actionable CSV + JSON reports.
impact: First scan caught 1,021 dead models across 204 properties
Proactive detection before customers report oops errors
Full scan of 20K models completes in under 10 minutes
Dead model report mapped to property IDs for targeted fixes

timeSaved.calculation: Manual verification of 20K models is impossible — conservatively 2 hrs/week of reactive ticket investigation eliminated

projects.name: Redirect Checker
projects.description: Validates TrueTour embed URLs for broken redirects. Anti-detection Selenium bypasses Cloudflare. Team posts 'check redirects: [URL]' in #support-internal and gets results with Google Sheets link. Tags @Lucas if crawl finds 0 results.
impact: Self-service redirect scans via Slack
Anti-detection bypasses Cloudflare blocks
Results auto-exported to Google Sheets
Deduplication: same tour URL checked once
